channel.title: Suggested anti virus?
channel.description:
Okay so I just got the cracked windows 7 installed...what software would be best for it? Please don't say Norton/Avg cause it won't happen. I would [b]prefer[/b[ a cracked version of a paid software so please give link to the video or site also :)
thanks

item.title: Suggested anti virus?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

After reviewing several different ones listed I have decided to get Malware Bytes/Spybot/Hijack this

could somebody please lock this topic

-love <3

Read full topic

item.title: Suggested anti virus?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:20, topic:418293”][quote author=Ix Soulcist xI link=topic=520840.msg3783921#msg3783921 date=1318703673]

NOT McAfee. That’s all I can say.

I heard a lot of bad things about that suite, heard it was on the active virus list itself or something, I don’t remember where I heard that information from though.
[/quote]
I’ll vouch. I got it to remove a virus that I had (which it did, successfully), and when I tried to uninstall it, it stayed hidden on my computer. I still get popups once a month about it wanting to scan my computer, and it just flat out pisses me off. It’s definitely in the viral area, although it may not actually compromise any information or security.[/quote]
Yeah I tried to uninstall it on a client’s computer, it was a cunt to do.
Just google mcaffee uninstaller or remover, there should be a tool that kills it completely somewhere.

Read full topic

item.title: Suggested anti virus?
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:3, topic:418293”]I use norton, but it does not catch everything, but this does. http://www.superantispyware.com/
This will catch everything, and its free.[/quote]
Just ran that, and like 600+ threats detected…

Read full topic

item.title: Suggested anti virus?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:19, topic:418293”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=520840.msg3783900#msg3783900 date=1318702960]
NOT McAfee. That’s all I can say.
[/quote]
I heard a lot of bad things about that suite, heard it was on the active virus list itself or something, I don’t remember where I heard that information from though.[/quote]
I’ll vouch. I got it to remove a virus that I had (which it did, successfully), and when I tried to uninstall it, it stayed hidden on my computer. I still get popups once a month about it wanting to scan my computer, and it just flat out pisses me off. It’s definitely in the viral area, although it may not actually compromise any information or security.

Read full topic

item.title: Suggested anti virus?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:13, topic:418293”]What’s wrong with AVG? Used it my whole life (except on an old computer where I used norton, eventually it killed it, don’t like norton), and I’ve never had a single virus that’s done any damage whatsoever, and I download some sketchy shit.[/quote]I’d rather not be haunted by my dad thanks though LOL

I have heard good stuff about Kaspersky anybody know if there is a cracked version? I am kind of wary of getting cracked stuff without prior knowledge of people giving it a thumbs up.

Read full topic

item.title: Suggested anti virus?
item.dc:creator: @judostar1 judostar1
item.description:
@judostar1 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:15, topic:418293”]Maybe you weren’t up to date
Operating system certainly wasn’t by the sounds of things.[/quote]

ehh, this was back in 01, when windows 2000 just came out, and it wasnt the os, it was the avg, I had avg free for awhile, really old though LOL. I’ve changed virus a lot.

eyeownyew:

NOT McAfee. That’s all I can say.

I agree, I had 30 days with it, right after i took it out and put a new virus program in, the thing found 30 trojan droppers and 2 trojens.

Read full topic

item.title: Suggested anti virus?
item.dc:creator: @judostar1 judostar1
item.description:
@judostar1 wrote:

SilentCJ:

What’s wrong with AVG? Used it my whole life (except on an old computer where I used norton, eventually it killed it, don’t like norton), and I’ve never had a single virus that’s done any damage whatsoever, and I download some sketchy shit.

I used to have AVG, I even bought it, one day a worm popped into my old pc (windows 98) and avg didnt pick up shit.

When it did pick it up, the logo that avg used to put them as (I had a pig and a cigarette(like wtf?)) Fucking freaked me out.

Read full topic
